headline.main: AFFAIRS ON THE UPPER POTOMAC.; The Late Rebel Outrage--The Shooting of Rohr under a Flag of Truce-- Destruction of a Large Portion of Harper's Ferry by Fire-Skirmishing. &c. docs.snippet: THE AMENDMENTS PROPOSED BY MR. M'LEOD'S BILL. An Act to amend the Act entitled. "An Act to amend the Charter of the City of New-York," passed April 14, 1857.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE AMENDMENTS PROPOSED BY MR. M'LEOD'S BILL. An Act to amend the Act entitled. "An Act to amend the Charter of the City of New-York," passed April 14, 1857.

docs.snippet: The steamer Suwannee, with the mail, leaves today, and I improve the opportunity to bring up affairs to this date.

headline.main: OUR PAMLICO SOUND CORRESPONDENCE.; PREPARATIONS FOR A MOVEMENT COMPLETED THE GUNNERS DRILLING DISPOSITION FOR THE ATTACK REBEL SURMISES GEN. BURNSIDE CONFIDENT OF SUCCESS. THE WRECK OF THE POCAHONTAS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Suwannee, with the mail, leaves today, and I improve the opportunity to bring up affairs to this date.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, favorable reports were made on the bills to close part of Partitionstreet, Brooklyn; to organize an Asylum for insane convicts, and to amend the laws for incorporating Life and Health Insurance Companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, favorable reports were made on the bills to close part of Partitionstreet, Brooklyn; to organize an Asylum for insane convicts, and to amend the laws for incorporating Life and Health Insurance Companies.

headline.main: THE CONTRACT FRAUDS; A Further Exposition of Their Enormity. Speech of Mr. Van Wyck, of New-York, Chairman of the House Special Committee. CATTLE CONTRACT. PURCHASE OF HALL'S CARBINES. DEPARTMENT OF THE WEST. ARMY TRANSPORTATION.

docs.snippet: Having visited Fortress Monroe for the purpose of insuring the transmission of my letters from the Burnside Expedition, I started to return yesterday afternoon, on board of the steam-tag John P. Levy, one of six vessels which had been chartered for...

headline.main: THE BURNSIDE EXPEDITION; The Vessels and Troops Still at Hatteras Inlet. All the Large Armed Vessels and Transports Over the Swash.FIVE REGIMENTS LANDEDA Move to the Mainland to beMade Soon.A Perilous Voyage from Fortress Monroe to Hatteras. STATUS OF THE EXPEDITION. ROSTER OF THE EIGHTY-NINTH REGIMENT, N. Y. S. VOL., ON BOARD SHIP ARRACAN. RUMORS OF SURRENDER. A SPY AFLOAT. THE SIGNAL CORPS SAFE. REMAINS OF DECRASED OFFICERS SENT HOME.

docs.lead_paragraph: Having visited Fortress Monroe for the purpose of insuring the transmission of my letters from the Burnside Expedition, I started to return yesterday afternoon, on board of the steam-tag John P. Levy, one of six vessels which had been chartered for service at this point.
